recipe.title: Banana and Coconut Appam with Jaggery Sugar
recipe.directions: Soak the basmati rice for 4 hours and drain. Place the rice, coconut, banana and coconut milk in a blender or food processor and blend until smooth. Preheat your oven to 50 C and leave it to warm up for 5 minutes or until just under 50 C., then switch off the heat. Pour the batter into a mixing bowl, add the salt and cover it with foil. Place the bowl into the warm oven and leave it for at least 3 hours or until the batter is slightly bubbly and frothy. Alternatively if it is a hot summer day - leave the batter out on your kitchen work surface for 5 to 6 hours. Stir the batter to remix it and check the consistency. It should be quite loose and runny when poured from a ladle. If it appears to be too thick and pours in wide ribbons from the ladle, add a little water to thin it out. Heat a shallow frying pan over medium heat and add approximately 1 tbsp of oil. Swirl the oil around to coat the base. Pour a ladleful of batter over the pan an spread it around the base. Cover the pan with a lid and reduce the heat slightly. Cook the appam until the underside is golden and crispy, approximately 3 minutes. Slide out onto a plate and grate some of the jaggery sugar on top. Serve hot. >
